radiographic_examinations.findings: The visualized portion of the heart is normal. No acute changes are seen at the lung bases. Calcification or suture material at the right lung base is redemonstrated with adjacent fatty pleural thickening. The liver is normal without focal or diffuse abnormality. The gallbladder is absent. The intra- and extra-hepatic bile ducts, pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly. The ureters are normal in course and caliber. The stomach is normal. Hyperenhancing diverticulum along the antimesenteric border of the ascending colon (2:45) has surrounding fat stranding and is consistent with acute uncomplicated diverticulitis. No extraluminal air or fluid collection is visualized. The small and large bowel otherwise enhance homogeneously and have a normal course and caliber. The appendix appears normal. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. The portal and intra-abdominal systemic vasculature are normal. No abdominal wall hernia, pneumoperitoneum, or free abdominal fluid. In the pelvis, the bladder and terminal ureters are normal. The prostate gland is unremarkable. No pelvic side-wall or inguinal lymphadenopathy. No free pelvic fluid or inguinal hernia. No focal lytic or sclerotic lesion concerning for malignancy.
